question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
$P(x)$ is a polynomial such that when $P(x)$ is divided by $x-13$ the remainder is $19$, and when $P(x)$ is divided by $x+17$ the remainder is $-11$. What is the remainder when $P(x)$ is divided by $(x-13)(x+17)$?
inference:
By the Remainder Theorem, if $P(x)$ is divided by $x-a$, the remainder is $P(a)$.
Thus, $P(13) = 19$ and $P(-17) = -11$.
When $P(x)$ is divided by $(x-13)(x+17)$, the remainder is of the form $ax+b$, where $a$ and $b$ are constants.
So $P(x) = Q(x)(x-13)(x+17) + ax+b$ for some polynomial $Q(x)$.
Then $P(13) = 13a + b = 19$
$P(-17) = -17a + b = -11$
Subtracting the second equation from the first equation, we get
$13a + b - (-17a + b) = 19 - (-11)$
$13a + b + 17a - b = 19 + 11$
$30a = 30$
$a = 1$
Substituting $a=1$ into $13a + b = 19$, we get
$13(1) + b = 19$
$13 + b = 19$
$b = 6$
So the remainder when $P(x)$ is divided by $(x-13)(x+17)$ is $x+6$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{x+6}$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Since we are dividing by a quadratic, the remainder will have degree less than 2. So the remainder $r(x)=ax+b$ for some constants $a$ and $b$. We have,
$$P(x) = (x-13)(x+17)Q(x) +ax+b$$where $Q(x)$ is the quotient of the division.

Then, using the Remainder Theorem,
$$\begin{aligned} P(13) &= 13a+b = 19 \\
P(-17) &= -17a+b = -11 \end{aligned}$$.
Solving this system of equations gives us $a=1$ and $b=6$. So the remainder is $\boxed{x+6}$.

Thus, $P(13) = 19$ and $P(-17) = -11$.
When $P(x)$ is divided by $(x-13)(x+17)$, the remainder is of the form $ax+b$, where $a$ and $b$ are constants.

Then $P(13) = 13a + b = 19$
$P(-17) = -17a + b = -11$
Subtracting the second equation from the first equation, we get
$13a + b - (-17a + b) = 19 - (-11)$
$13a + b + 17a - b = 19 + 11$
$30a = 30$
$a = 1$

$13(1) + b = 19$
$13 + b = 19$

$$P(x) = (x-13)(x+17)Q(x) +ax+b$$where $Q(x)$ is the quotient of the division.

Then, using the Remainder Theorem,
$$\begin{aligned} P(13) &= 13a+b = 19 \\

Solving this system of equations gives us $a=1$ and $b=6$. So the remainder is $\boxed{x+6}$.
